content:
WmlMobileTextWriter Class

Definition

Provides a mobile text writer adapter class for the WML device adapter set. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

In this Article

[System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")]
public class WmlMobileTextWriter : System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.MobileTextWriter

Constructors

WmlMobileTextWriter(TextWriter,MobileCapabilities,MobilePage)

Creates a new instance of the specified class. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public WmlMobileTextWriter (System.IO.TextWriter writer, System.Web.Mobile.MobileCapabilities device, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage page);
writer
TextWriter

The base writer object.

device
MobileCapabilities

An object of the MobileCapabilities class that provides the capability information for the specific device.

page
MobilePage

The mobile page to write to.

Remarks

Adapters are usually constructed automatically by ASP.NET, and must have a default constructor.

Properties

AnalyzeMode

Sets or returns whether the writer is in analyze mode. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public bool AnalyzeMode { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the writer is in analyze mode; otherwise, false.

Remarks

WML rendering is done in two phases. In the first phase, all calls to the renderer are analyzed for correctness. In the second phase, the rendering is performed.

CurrentForm

Returns the form currently being rendered. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form CurrentForm { get; }
Value
Form

The form currently being rendered.

DefaultFormat

Returns the default character formatting used by the device. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat DefaultFormat { get; }
Value

The default character formatting used by the device.

Remarks

Called internally by the writer, and can be overridden by inheriting classes.

DefaultLayout

Returns the default layout used by the device. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlLayout DefaultLayout { get; }
Value

The default layout used by the device.

Remarks

Called internally by the writer, and can be overridden by inheriting classes.

NumberOfSoftkeys

Returns the number of softkeys supported on the device. The default value is 0. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected int NumberOfSoftkeys { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of softkeys supported on the device.

Remarks

Softkeys are special keys that the application can usually map to custom tasks. Softkey text is displayed on the screen in the lower-left and lower-right corners.

Page

Returns the page associated with the device adapter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage Page { get; }
Value
MobilePage

The page associated with the device adapter.

Remarks

Equivalent to calling the Control.MobilePage.

PendingBreak

Indicates whether the < br > tag needs to be sent to the output stream. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected bool PendingBreak { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the < br > tag needs to be sent to the output stream; otherwise, false.

Methods

AddFormVariable(String,String,Boolean)

Adds a variable to be initialized when the browser renders the form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void AddFormVariable (string clientID, string value, bool generateRandomID);
clientID
String

The identifier for the control containing the variable to initialize.

value
String

The value to which the variable is initialized when the browser renders the form.

generateRandomID
Boolean

true to encrypt the identifier for the control; otherwise, false.

Remarks

All references to the client identifier on the page are mapped, resulting in the same postback regardless of mapping. The AddFormVariable method also can scramble client IDs that must be encrypted for security reasons. Only visible controls generate variables.

AnalyzePostBack(Boolean,WmlPostFieldType)

Analyzes a single postback. Called internally by the writer and inherited classes. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void AnalyzePostBack (bool includeVariables, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPostFieldType postBackType);
includeVariables
Boolean

true to include in the post fields the information for all IPostBackDataHandler interfaces in the form; false to include no IPostBackDataHandler information.

postBackType
WmlPostFieldType

The WmlPostFieldType.

Remarks

Override or call this method when advanced extensibility is required while extending the WmlMobileTextWriter class.

BeginCustomMarkup()

Begins a custom markup section. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void BeginCustomMarkup ();

Remarks

The BeginCustomMarkup and EndCustomMarkup methods allow a device adapter to create a section of custom markup elements.

BeginForm(Form)

Begins the given form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void BeginForm (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form form);
form
Form

The form to begin.

Remarks

Use this method and the EndForm method when rendering a form.

CalculateFormPostBackUrl(Boolean,Boolean)

Returns the calculated URL required to post the form to the server. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual string CalculateFormPostBackUrl (bool externalSubmit, ref bool encode);
externalSubmit
Boolean

true to indicate that the current form submits to an external URL; otherwise, false.

encode
Boolean

true to encode the URL string; otherwise, false.

Returns
String

The calculated URL required to post the form to the server.

Remarks

Called internally by the writer, and can be overridden by an inheriting class (writer).

CalculateFormQueryString()

Returns the query string to add to the URL to post the form to the server. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual string CalculateFormQueryString ();
Returns
String

The query string.

Remarks

Called internally by the writer, and can be overridden by an inheriting class.

CloseCharacterFormat()

Closes any currently open character formatting tags. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void CloseCharacterFormat ();

Remarks

Called internally by the writer, and can be overridden by an inheriting class.

CloseParagraph()

Closes an open paragraph. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void CloseParagraph ();

Remarks

Called internally by the writer, and can be overridden by an inheriting class.

EndCustomMarkup()

Ends a custom markup section. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void EndCustomMarkup ();

Remarks

The BeginCustomMarkup and EndCustomMarkup methods allow a device adapter to create a section of custom markup elements.

EndForm()

Ends the current form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void EndForm ();

Remarks

Use the BeginForm method and this method when rendering a form.

EnsureFormat()

Ensures that character formatting tags corresponding to the current format have been written. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void EnsureFormat ();

Remarks

Called internally by the writer, and can be overridden by an inheriting class.

EnsureLayout()

Ensures that a < p > tag corresponding to the current layout has been written. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void EnsureLayout ();

Remarks

Called internally by the writer, and can be overridden by an inheriting class.

EnterFormat(Style)

Begins a block by using the character formatting from a specified style. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void EnterFormat (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style style);
style
Style

The specified style to use for formatting characters

EnterLayout(Style)

Begins a block by using the formatting from a given style. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void EnterLayout (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style style);
style
Style

The style reference.

ExitFormat(Style)

Ends a block that has been using the character formatting from a specified style. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void ExitFormat (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style style);
style
Style

The specified style to use for formatting characters.

ExitLayout(Style,Boolean)

Ends a block by using the formatting from a given style. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void ExitLayout (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Style style, bool breakAfter);
style
Style

The style reference.

breakAfter
Boolean

If breakAfter is true, a break is added after the closing style element. The first form of the method assumes breakAfter to be true.

IsValidSoftkeyLabel(String)

Returns whether the given string is a valid softkey label for the target device. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual bool IsValidSoftkeyLabel (string label);
label
String

The label to validate.

Returns
Boolean

true if the given string is a valid softkey label for the target device; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Adapters can use this method to determine whether a label is appropriate for a softkey.

MapClientIDToShortName(String,Boolean)

Maps the client ID of a control to a short name to be used in rendering on the form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected string MapClientIDToShortName (string clientID, bool generateRandomID);
clientID
String

The client ID of a control to map.

generateRandomID
Boolean

Determines whether the client ID is encrypted.

Returns
String

A string representation of the client identifier of the control.

Remarks

If the client identifier of a control is longer than 16 characters, ASP.NET substitutes a uniquely mapped short name.

All references to the client identifier on the page are mapped, resulting in the same postback regardless of mapping. MapClientIDToShortName can also scramble client IDs that must be encrypted for security reasons.

OpenCharacterFormat(WmlMobileTextWriter+WmlFormat,Boolean,Boolean,Boolean)

Opens character formatting tags for the given format. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void OpenCharacterFormat (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlFormat format, bool writeBold, bool writeItalic, bool writeSize);
format

An enumerated value representing the WML format to use while writing.

writeBold
Boolean

Whether to open bold character formatting.

writeItalic
Boolean

Whether to open italic character formatting.

writeSize
Boolean

Whether to open character size formatting.

Remarks

Called internally by the writer, and can be overridden by an inheriting class.

OpenParagraph(WmlMobileTextWriter+WmlLayout,Boolean,Boolean)

Opens a paragraph with the given layout. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void OpenParagraph (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlMobileTextWriter.WmlLayout layout, bool writeAlignment, bool writeWrapping);
layout

An enumerated value representing the layout to use when opening a paragraph.

writeAlignment
Boolean

Whether to open paragraph alignment formatting.

writeWrapping
Boolean

Whether to open paragraph wrapping formatting.

Remarks

Called internally by the writer, and can be overridden by an inheriting class.

PostAnalyzeForm()

Analyzes a form after it is completed during the analyze phase. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void PostAnalyzeForm ();

Remarks

Called internally by the writer, and can be overridden by an inheriting class.

RenderBeginForm(Form)

Renders the beginning of a form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void RenderBeginForm (System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Form form);
form
Form

The form to begin rendering.

Remarks

Called internally by the writer, and can be overridden by an inheriting class.

RenderBeginHyperlink(String,Boolean,String,Boolean,Boolean)

Begins rendering a hyperlink element. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void RenderBeginHyperlink (string targetUrl, bool encodeUrl, string softkeyLabel, bool implicitSoftkeyLabel, bool mapToSoftkey);
targetUrl
String

The URL target.

encodeUrl
Boolean

Set to true if the URL is encoded.

softkeyLabel
String

The softkey text to use for the link if the mapToSoftKey parameter is set to true.

implicitSoftkeyLabel
Boolean

Set to true if the softkey label comes from the adapter itself (the default label, or something else that is adapter-specified, such as "Call" for a PhoneCall control, rather than a softkey label explicitly specified by the application author).

mapToSoftkey
Boolean

Set to true if mapping to a softkey on the device.

Remarks

This call can be followed by calls to render text or by a call to the RenderImage method to render the hyperlink contents, followed by a call to the RenderEndHyperlink method.

RenderBeginPostBack(String,Boolean,Boolean)

Begins the rendering of a postback. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void RenderBeginPostBack (string softkeyLabel, bool implicitSoftkeyLabel, bool mapToSoftkey);
softkeyLabel
String

The softkey text to use for the link if the mapToSoftKey parameter is set to true.

implicitSoftkeyLabel
Boolean

Set to true if the softkey label comes from the adapter itself, rather than being a softkey label explicitly specified by the application author.

mapToSoftkey
Boolean

Set to true if mapping to a softkey on the device.

RenderBeginSelect(String,String,String,String,Boolean)

Begins rendering a selection list. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void RenderBeginSelect (string name, string iname, string ivalue, string title, bool multiSelect);
name
String

The name of the control.

iname
String

The name that the browser must use to submit the selected index back to the server.

ivalue
String

The initial value.

title
String

The Title attribute on WML devices.

multiSelect
Boolean

Whether to allow multiple selections.

Remarks

Either name or iname must be non-null.

This method can be followed by calls to the RenderSelectOption method for each option, followed by a call to the RenderEndSelect method to end the selection list.

RenderDoEvent(String,String,String,WmlPostFieldType,String,Boolean)

Renders a < do > event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected void RenderDoEvent (string doType, string target, string arg, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPostFieldType postBackType, string text, bool includeVariables);
doType
String

The type of action to render. Maps to the type attribute of the < do > element. Usually "accept" or "options".

target
String

The ID of the control targeted by the action. When the user selects the action, a postback is generated, targeting the control specified by this ID.

arg
String

The argument for the action. The argument is included in the postback generated when the user selects the action.

postBackType
WmlPostFieldType

The WmlPostFieldType type used for arg.

text
String

The label associated with the action. This usually appears as a softkey label on the device.

includeVariables
Boolean

Whether to include all variables on the form when posting back to the server.

Remarks

If the control you are targeting is the current form and you want to include all the variables when posting back to the server, you can use the RenderFormDoEvent method. Called internally by the writer and inherited classes.

RenderEndForm()

Completes rendering of a form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual void RenderEndForm ();

Remarks

Called internally by the writer, and can be overridden by an inheriting class.

RenderEndHyperlink(Boolean)

Completes the rendering of a hyperlink element. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void RenderEndHyperlink (bool breakAfter);
breakAfter
Boolean

Set to true if a break is required after the link.

RenderEndPostBack(String,String,WmlPostFieldType,Boolean,Boolean)

Completes the rendering of a postback. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void RenderEndPostBack (string target, string argument, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPostFieldType postBackType, bool includeVariables, bool breakAfter);
target
String

Contains the target URL of the postback.

argument
String

Contains the argument associated with the target URL.

postBackType
WmlPostFieldType

Specifies the type of postback. Must be a value from the WmlPostFieldType enumeration.

includeVariables
Boolean

Contains a Boolean value indicating whether postback variables should be calculated.

breakAfter
Boolean

Contains true if a line break should follow the control. Contains false otherwise.

RenderEndSelect(Boolean)

Completes rendering a selection list. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void RenderEndSelect (bool breakAfter);
breakAfter
Boolean

Indicates whether a break must follow the selection list.

RenderExtraCards()

Renders any extra cards that the writer needs to send to the browser. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void RenderExtraCards ();

Remarks

Depending on the content of the form, the writer might need to send additional cards to the browser. Called by the form adapter.

RenderFormDoEvent(String,String,WmlPostFieldType,String)

Renders a < do > event for the current form. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected void RenderFormDoEvent (string doType, string arg, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPostFieldType postBackType, string text);
doType
String

The type of action to render. Maps to the type attribute of the element. Usually "accept" or "options".

arg
String

The argument for the action. The argument is included in the postback generated when the user selects the action.

postBackType
WmlPostFieldType

The WmlPostFieldType type used for arg.

text
String

The label associated with the action. This usually appears as a softkey label on the device.

Remarks

Called internally by the writer and inherited classes.

RenderGoAction(String,String,WmlPostFieldType,Boolean)

Renders a < go > action. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void RenderGoAction (string target, string argument, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPostFieldType postBackType, bool includeVariables);
target
String

The ID of the control targeted by the action. When the user selects the action, a postback is generated, targeting the control specified by this ID.

argument
String

The argument for the action. The argument is included in the postback generated when the user selects the action.

postBackType
WmlPostFieldType

The WmlPostFieldType type used for arg.

includeVariables
Boolean

Whether to include all variables on the form when posting back to the server.

Remarks

Called internally by the writer or inherited classes.

RenderImage(String,String,String,Boolean)

Renders an image element. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void RenderImage (string source, string localSource, string alternateText, bool breakAfter);
source
String

Specifies the image URL.

localSource
String

Specifies an optional local image name.

alternateText
String

Specifies text to display if the image cannot be displayed.

breakAfter
Boolean

Set to true if a break is required after the image.

RenderSelectOption(String)

Renders a single option within a selection list. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void RenderSelectOption (string text);
text
String

The option text.

RenderSelectOption(String,String)

Renders a single option within a selection list. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void RenderSelectOption (string text, string value);
text
String

The option text.

value
String

(Optional.) The option value.

RenderText(String)

Renders a text element. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void RenderText (string text);
text
String

The text string to be rendered.

RenderText(String,Boolean)

Renders a text element. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void RenderText (string text, bool breakAfter);
text
String

The text string to be rendered.

breakAfter
Boolean

Specifies whether a break must follow the element.

RenderText(String,Boolean,Boolean)

Renders a text element. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void RenderText (string text, bool breakAfter, bool encodeText);
text
String

The text string to be rendered.

breakAfter
Boolean

Specifies whether a break must follow the element.

encodeText
Boolean

Specifies whether the text must be encoded.

RenderTextBox(String,String,String,String,Boolean,Int32,Int32,Boolean,Boolean)

Renders a text-box element. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void RenderTextBox (string id, string value, string format, string title, bool password, int size, int maxLength, bool generateRandomID, bool breakAfter);
id
String

Identifies the control.

value
String

Specifies the initial value of the text box.

format
String

Specifies an optional WML format string.

title
String

Contains the title of the text box.

password
Boolean

Specifies the password.

size
Int32

Sets the size of the string.

maxLength
Int32

Specifies the maximum length of the string.

generateRandomID
Boolean

Determines whether the identifier for the control (ID) is encrypted.

breakAfter
Boolean

Set to true if a break is required after the control is rendered.

Remarks

This method can also scramble client IDs that must be encrypted for security reasons.

ResetFormattingState()

Resets the character formatting. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public virtual void ResetFormattingState ();

Remarks

This method closes all character formatting tags, such as < b >, that have been opened.

UsePostBackCard(Boolean)

Whether the writer must use an additional card for postbacks. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected virtual bool UsePostBackCard (bool includeVariables);
includeVariables
Boolean

Whether to include any variables in the additional card.

Returns
Boolean

true if the writer must use an additional card for postbacks; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Called internally by the writer, and can be overridden by an inheriting class.

WriteAttribute(String,String,Boolean)

Writes the specified markup attribute and value to the output stream, and, if specified, writes the value encoded. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void WriteAttribute (string attribute, string value, bool encode);
attribute
String

The markup attribute to write to the output stream.

value
String

The value assigned to the attribute.

encode
Boolean

true to encode the attribute and its assigned value; otherwise, false.

WriteBreak()

Writes a line break.

protected void WriteBreak ();

WriteEncodedText(String)

Encodes the specified text for the requesting device, and then writes it to the output stream. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void WriteEncodedText (string text);
text
String

The text string to encode and write to the output stream.

WriteEncodedUrl(String)

Encodes the specified URL, and then writes it to the output stream. The URL might include parameters. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public override void WriteEncodedUrl (string url);
url
String

The URL string to encode and write to the output stream.

WritePostField(String,String)

Writes a < postfield > element, using the provided parameters. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void WritePostField (string name, string value);
name
String

The field name.

value
String

The post field value.

Remarks

There is an assumed type parameter that defaults to WmlPostFieldType.

WritePostField(String,String,WmlPostFieldType)

Writes a < postfield > element, treating the value as specified by the type parameter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void WritePostField (string name, string value, System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Adapters.WmlPostFieldType type);
name
String

The field name.

value
String

The post field value.

type
WmlPostFieldType

The WmlPostFieldType.

WritePostFieldVariable(String,String)

Writes a post field, treating the arg parameter as a variable name. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void WritePostFieldVariable (string name, string arg);
name
String

The field name.

arg
String

The variable name to write.

Remarks

You can use the short form as follows: WritePostField(name, value, WmlPostFieldType.Normal).

WriteText(String,Boolean)

Writes the given text, encoding it if desired. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

public void WriteText (string text, bool encodeText);
text
String

The text to write.

encodeText
Boolean

If true, encodes the text.

Remarks

Encoding involves mapping characters with HTML/WML meanings to the appropriate character code.

WriteTextEncodedAttribute(String,String)

Writes the given attribute, encoding the value by using WML text encoding. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the www.asp.net/mobile Web site.

protected void WriteTextEncodedAttribute (string attribute, string value);
attribute
String

The name of the attribute to encode.

value
String

The value of the attribute to encode.

Remarks

Encoding involves mapping characters with HTML/WML meanings to the appropriate character code.
